meanings.definition: Make a repeated, sharp sound in the throat due to involuntary contractions of the diaphragm.
meanings.sent1: She was hiccuping loudly after drinking soda too quickly.
meanings.sent2: The baby started hiccuping after a fit of giggles.
meanings.sent3: The hiccuping sound coming from the puppy was both cute and funny.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter hiccuping through the phone line made him smile.
meanings.sent5: The engine hiccuping reminded him of a beat-up old car struggling to start.

meanings.definition: A repeated, sharp sound in the throat due to involuntary contractions of the diaphragm.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that hiccups or hiccuping are common after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent2: The loud hiccuping interrupted the silence of the room.
meanings.sent3: The hiccuping of the machine sounded like a tiny drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The hiccuping of the old clock was a comforting sound in the quiet house.
meanings.sent5: The hiccuping of the kitten made everyone in the room chuckle.
